Assalamu Alaikum & Ramadan Mubarak.

Ramadan Announcement

According to the Fiqh Council of North America (FCNA), MAS MN is pleased to announce the first day of Ramadan will insha’ Allah be Wednesdsy, May 16, 2018.

The Muslim American Society of Minnesota wishes you a blessed and joyous  Ramadan.

  • First Day of Ramadan is on Saturday, May 16th, 2018 Insha’Allah!
  • First Night of Taraweeh is on Tuesday, May 15th, 2018
    (Taraweeh prayer is held at all MAS locations – Blaine, Rosemount & St. Paul)

Ramadan is a time for inner reflection, contemplation, discipline, and devotion to God.  May Allah allow us to witness Ramadan, benefit from it and accept it from us, Ameen!

 

MAS Annual Iftar Dinner Fundraiser

This Ramadan, we pray that Allah accepts all our ibadah such as fasting, praying and reading Quran. As you know, serving Allah through our donations of sadaka and zakat is also a form of ibadah.

MAS MN is holding its annual fundraisers at two locations this year.

15400 South Robert Trail, Rosemount, MN 55068

MAS Blaine Annual Ramadan Fundraiser Dinner

MAS Blaine Center
12175 Aberdeen St. NE Blaine, MN 55449

item.content:encoded:
MAS 5K Color Run & Walk for Mental Health Awareness

Assalamualaikom!

Welcome to the MAS MN Color Run & Walk for Mental Health Awareness. This is our first 5K Run & Walk in the Twin Cities. This is our chance as Muslims to come together and show our support for people with mental health issues.

Mental Illness in the Muslim community has recently become a pressing issue, especially amongst our youth. However, an even bigger issue is the stigma around mental health illness, becoming a major barrier for individuals who need help. This 5k color run aims to attract every one of all ages from high school students to college students to parents and families all together. We want to promote exercise, unity, and most importantly; raise awareness about the importance of mental health so that we can fight the stigma of mental health illnesses.

Event Guidelines

  • This is a family event. People of all ages and walks of life are welcome. 
  • Kids under 5 are free of charge and welcome at our event. Parents are responsible for their own children. 
  • All proceeds from this event will go toward scholarships for students obtaining a degree in mental health fields.
  • Expect to show your ID at the event location.
  • All registrants found violating registration policy and pricing will be charged accordingly.
  • Please dress modestly for this event. Shorts and pants should reach below the knee. Shirts need to have sleeves. Wear comfortable shoes. People of all faiths are welcome.
  • T-Shirts are handed out for free based on registration. Please register below to receive your free T-shirt.
  • Supportive signs and posters are welcome. 
  • We do not allow vulgar language or anything that promotes hate or violence.
  • We will have medical personnel(s) present at the event and first aid kit(s). In case of emergency, please allow space for professionals to administer help to those in need.
  • If you wish to sponsor our event, please email us at masmncolorrun@gmail.com.

To register for the event, click below!

 

To sponsor this event click below!

 

Driving Directions to The Park

Directions from North

Follow I-35W S towards I-694 W. Take exit 37 from I-694 W. Continue on MN-47 S/State Hwy 47 S. Drive to Jefferson St NE in Columbia Heights.

 

Directions from South

Follow I-35W N towards I-694 W. Take exit 37 from I-694 W. Continue on MN-47 S/State Hwy 47 S   . Drive to Jefferson St NE in Columbia Heights.

item.content:encoded:
The 14th Muslim Day at the Capitol (MDAC) is on Tuesday, March 20, 2018. You can help convey the concerns and needs of the Muslim community to the legislators.

Muslim Day at the Capitol consists of three components:

  1. Training is provided for participants on how to interact with legislators and lobby them for your concerns. The training is scheduled to start at 8:00 am in Conference Room 316, 3rd Floor, State Capitol. A light brunch will be provided.
  2. A rally is held at 09:30 am at the State Capitol Rotunda. All participants gather to hear elected leadership and community leaders speak to the Muslim community.
  3. Attendees go in small groups to meet with legislators and speak to them about Muslim concerns. We are making appointments on behalf of attendees as we speak.

Join your Muslim neighbors – doctors, engineers, business people, senior citizens, high school students, college students, stay at home parents and many many others – to show the strength and diversity of the Muslim community in Minnesota. Participants in the MDAC will have an opportunity to meet State Legislators to discuss issues relating to education, immigration, healthcare, and civil rights and help bring about positive social change. It is very important for the Muslim community to interact with our legislators and be positive participating citizens in the larger community.

Special Travel Package Deal

We are pleased to announce a special travel package for Minnesota. You can travel in comfort with your friends and family in a luxury coach.

The Special Minnesota Travel Package includes:

  • Travel to Chicago in a luxury coach bus (Round Trip).
  • Convention Registration Fee is covered in the package.
  • Room at the Hyatt Hotel at the Convention Center (Quadruple Occupancy – Four persons per room).
  • Registrants need to arrive by 5:30 AM to check in and load up their luggage.
  • The buses will depart Minnesota at 6:00 am on Thursday December 28th & will arrive in Chicago at approximately 2:00 pm.
  • The buses will depart Chicago at 11:00 pm on Saturday December 30th from the convention center.
  • We will arrive in Minnesota at approximately 9:00 am Sunday morning. (All night driving).
  • The arrivals and departures will take place at two locations:
  • Inver Grove Heights (4100 E 66th Street. Inver Grove Heights, MN 55076).
  • Blaine Masjid (12175 Aberdeen Street, Blaine, MN 55449).
  • Cost $300 per person.
  • Discount for MAS MN Members and supporters $225.
  • Please Note: Meals are NOT included in this package.

Confirmation Deadline: To participate in the MN Travel Package, you must sign up and pay by December 19th.

Click here to sign up!

To learn more about the convention please visit www.masconvention.org

item.title: Welcome to the 2017 MAS MN Convention!
item.dc:creator: ahmedsh11990@gmail.com
item.description: Online Registration is closed. You Can still purchase your tickets at the Convention on Saturday, […]
item.content:encoded:
Online Registration is closed. You Can still purchase your tickets at the Convention on Saturday, October 28, 10am-10pm at the Minneapolis Convention Center.

Assalamu Alaikom and welcome to he MAS MN Convention! This page has all the information pertaining to the convention and will be updated periodically to reflect new updates and announcements.

We have an amazing line up of nationally renowned speakers, engaging programs, Quran Competition, Islamic Knowledge Competition, vibrant and diverse bazaar, unique family-friendly entertainment and more! As always, our goal is to ensure that the convention is both memorable and beneficial for you and your loved ones.  

Our theme this year “Together for a better tomorrow” is an important topic worthy of discussion in this day and time. How can we plan and build for our future as a community and how can we do so TOGETHER? Our speakers will dissect this topic from their area of expertise and give us a unique perspective on how to do just that, insha’Allah.  

Download our program here.

 

 

Last year the MAS MN Quran Competition has become an instant classic. This year the buzz is even bigger! Drawing in families and competitors alike; the Competition is praised for its rigor and ease of access. With thousands of dollars in awards and a prestigious following; Dugsis and Quran schools are vying to score our highest ranks. Click here to register. (Registration only guarantees entree for Competitors. Their families and all others have to purchase their own tickets for convention). Our Quran Competition is divided into 4 levels:

 

 

 

MAS MN is excited to announce our first ever Islamic Knowledge Competition to take place during the Convention. 3 Competitions will be be held throughout the program and 15 prizes will be awarded! Awards include a Hover Board, iPad Mini, $50, $30 and $20 and awarded to the 5 highest scores during each session. You can compete for any session and the questions are designed to be easy and in every one’s pool of general Islamic knowledge.Think you got the what it takes for it? Download the flyer to see all the details and purchase your tickets today (right)!
